body.p: I have seen Dr Hurd, & find the story I told you is not true, tho' (I thought) I had it on very good authority. he was indeed ill at Thurcaston, but not so since, & walk'd an hour in Lincoln's-Inn walks with me very hearty, tho' his complexion presages no good. St: is come to town, & in good health. the weather & the times look very gloomy, & hang on my spirits, tho' I go to the Italian Puppet-Shew (the reigning diversion) to exhilarate them. I return to Camb: on Tuesday next, where I desire you would send me a more exhilarating letter.

postscript.p: All your acquaintances here are well: Ld Newnham & Mr Ramsden, & all.
